results.title: With Yau Kai in Hong Kong
results.creator_credit: Gail Singer, David Springbett, Heather MacAndrew and Asterisk Film and Videotape Productions
results.brief_description: Takes a look at the life style of a 14 year old boy who lives in on a sampan in one of the harbours near Hong Kong. Highlights aspect of commerce and trade in the area and the intrusion of Western values in a traditional life style.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gail Singer, David Springbett, Heather MacAndrew and Asterisk Film and Videotape Productions

results.title: With Oscar in Peru
results.creator_credit: Kevan Barker, David Springbett, Heather MacAndrew, Asterisk Film and Videotape Productions and Journal Films
results.brief_description: A study of Oscar, thirteen, who lives at 13000 feet on the Peruvian altipiano. He is an active member of his community and is shown tending the village sheep, planting seedlings, spinning wool and harvesting the family’s potatoes. Shows the poverty and barren nature of the land and the lack of variety in the diet of the peasant farmer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kevan Barker, David Springbett, Heather MacAndrew, Asterisk Film and Videotape Productions and Journal Films

results.title: With Nang & Nakorn in Thailand
results.creator_credit: Gail Singer, David Springbett, Heather MacAndrew and Asterisk Film and Videotape Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the activities of tow boys in the village of Con May in Thailand, including catching fish and lizards with their bare hands. The film also notes the building of a traditional Thai house on stilts, and highlights religion, extended family relationships and their use of technology.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gail Singer, David Springbett, Heather MacAndrew and Asterisk Film and Videotape Productions

results.title: Footnotes to a war
results.creator_credit: Simone Di Bagno and United Nations Films
results.brief_description: By focusing on three refugees from Southeast Asia - a former soldier turned medic, a child, and a young woman - this film highlights some of the problems of resettlement and ensuing loss of cultural identity. Narrated by Lu Yu. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Simone Di Bagno and United Nations Films

results.title: Missiles of October
results.creator_credit: Anthony Page, Herbert Brodkin, Robert Berger and Viacom Enterprises
results.brief_description: A dramatic re-enactment of the twelve nerve-shattering days in October 1962, following the US discovery of Soviet missile bases in Cuba. The inner workings of government are revealed, as President John F. Kennedy and Nikita Khrushchev grapple with crisis diplomacy. Cast includes Ralph Bellamy, Howard da Silva, John Dehner, William Devane, Andrew Duggan, Dana Elcar, Larry Gates, James Olson, Nehemiah Persoff, William Prince, John Randolph and Martin Sheen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anthony Page, Herbert Brodkin, Robert Berger and Viacom Enterprises

results.title: Linda's film on menstruation
results.creator_credit: Linda Feferman, Georghe Eichen and Phoenix Films

results.title: Mother may I?
results.creator_credit: Linda Feferman, Gina Blumenfeld and Shared Futures Films
results.brief_description: SEX EDUCATION - Treats aspects of teeage sexuality in a narrative context. A sixteen-year-old girl fears that she may be pregnant but is reluctant to confide in her parents. Depicts her reactions to her predicament, as well as those of her boyfriend and eleven-year-old sister who share her anxiety. Raises issues surrounding pregnancy, adoption, abortion, and family relationships. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
